oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shadowbox of James C. Carnahan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Carnahan, Co. G, 8th Tenn.(Smith's) Cav. Regt., CSA, served under Capt. J. M. Nichols and Col. Baxter Smith. The shadowbox holds his U. C. V. reunion ribbons, buttons and medals, a funeral program, and an E. W. Carmack for Senate campaign button. His pension application indicates that he fought at Perryville, Chickamauga, Murfreesboro, Missionary Ridge and Resaca, and was imprisoned in Murfreesboro for one night and in Louisville for 6 weeks. He was paroled in Ohio after taking the oath.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Clothing; Medals; Programs; Weapons and ammunition
